name: querysurge-run-suite-task
description: Runs a Test Suite in a Scenario and optionally waits for completion
author: RTTS

inputs.name: host
inputs.label: QuerySurge hostname
inputs.helpMarkDown: Hostname/FQDN/IP address of QuerySurge server (ex. qs.mycorp.com)

inputs.name: useHttps
inputs.label: Use HTTPS
inputs.helpMarkDown: Whether to connect to the QuerySurge server via HTTPS (TLS/SSL). May require deployment of organizational CA certificates.

inputs.name: projectId
inputs.label: Project ID #
inputs.helpMarkDown: ID # of Project (found in Global Adminstration -> Projects)

inputs.name: suiteId
inputs.label: Test Suite ID #
inputs.helpMarkDown: ID # of Test Suite to run

inputs.name: scenarioName
inputs.label: Scenario Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of scenario (to identify scenario in the Run Dashboard)

inputs.name: appendTime
inputs.label: Append Time
inputs.helpMarkDown: Whether the current date/time will be appended to the scenario name (time is local to the QuerySurge app server).

inputs.name: pollingEnabled
inputs.label: Poll for Completion
inputs.helpMarkDown: Whether to wait until the scenario completes execution, and pass/fail the task based on scenario outcome (pass or fail/error)

inputs.name: scenarioOutcomeAction
inputs.label: Scenario outcome action
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Whether to affect pipeline execution based on QuerySurge scenario outcome. Available options: 
* __Succeed with issues on failed/warning/error/killed outcome__: Report "Succeeded with issues" when scenario does not pass
* __Fail on failed/warning/error/killed outcome__: Report task failure when scenario has QueryPairs with failures/warnings or scenario is killed
* __Fail on error/killed outcome__: Report task failure when scenario has QueryPairs/Staging Queries with errors or scenario is killed
* __Task always succeeds__: Pipeline execution not affected by scenario outcome (however, errors connecting to QuerySurge or starting scenario execution will still cause task failure)

options.issues: (Default) Succeed with issues on failed/warning/error/killed outcome

inputs.name: timeoutSecs
inputs.label: Timeout (in seconds)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Timeout for scenario execution in seconds. If execution exceeds the timeout, the task will fail. Minimum of 10 seconds; set to 0 or leave blank to disable (i.e. wait indefinitely, up to the pipeline timeout).
